segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems when there’s chaos right in front of them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is flooding the floor, and she’s just standing there in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, I’m amazed he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, like this is completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool is going to tip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re going to get caught soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the cabinets, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman ever looks up from her chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so tidy, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
